result.execSummary:
The defendant Lekenia J Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs and Restitution to be paid at $104.00 per month commencing 09/01/2022 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Restitution for Kohl's Dept Store to be paid along with costs payments. To be paid before costs and fees.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Sentence credit of 4 days were granted. Time Served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lekenia J Williams

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

8:35 AM Defendant Lekenia J Williams in court.  Attorney Kathleen A Lindgren in court for Lekenia J Williams.  ADA Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State has complied with victim's rights.
Court reads offer into the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 6.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

The defendant was sentenced to the following:

JAIL:  4 days (Credit - 4 days). TIME SERVED;

RESTITUTION:  $722 to Kohl's (Restitution to be paid before costs or fines); 
COSTS: $268; 
DNA SURCHARGE:  $250;
Defendant to provide DNA sample, within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Payment of Restitution/Costs/Surcharges:  Defendant to pay $104 /month commencing 9/01/22 and each month thereafter or civil judgment entered as penalty for non payment.
Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 3:37 PM 
District Attorney's Office Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lekenia J Williams in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren. 
Attorney Lindgren requests a different date for plea/sentencing before Judge Dorow.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

The Court notes that the Defendant was ready to go to plea/sentencing, however due to the Court's calendar can not.
The Court will adjourn.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on June 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:03 AM Defendant Lekenia J Williams in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Alissa Jay, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has received discovery and an offer.
Defense requests one further proceedings date.
  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on April 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:24 AM Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lekenia J Williams in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Request to appear by zoom.
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 03-14-2022 Per Court, request for Zoom appearance is Granted.
Prelim waived.
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.

08:29 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lekenia J Williams in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Attorney Lindgren states she was just appointed and requests an adjournment of the preliminary hearing.  Court adjourns noting time limits were previously waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.

02:42 PM Defendant Lekenia J Williams in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
